article_title: Brad Schaeffer—The Dodd-Frank Effect: 'Too Small to Succeed'
article_text:
I owned a small business by my industry's standards.

A small business is a job, not an asset. But it was a good job. It provided for my family and the families of my dedicated, reliable and professional co-workers. Business was good, the atmosphere relaxed and our customers, whom I'd come to know and respect, were happy with our services.

Then Congress unwittingly ensured that our success would not last, or if it did, that my...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Brad Schaeffer writes that the law crushed his small business with needless regulation and paperwork.
twitter.title: The Dodd-Frank Effect: 'Too Small to Succeed'
